com.myronmarston.music.settings
Class FractalPiece

java.lang.Object
  com.myronmarston.music.settings.FractalPiece

public class FractalPiece
extends java.lang.Object

The GrandDaddy of them all. This class controls the entire piece of music. Before generating the piece, you will need to provide values for each of the appropriate settings: the voices (via getVoices()), the sections (via getSections()), the germ, the scale, etc.

Constructor Detail

FractalPiece

public FractalPiece()
Method Detail

getGerm

public NoteList getGerm()
Returns the germ NoteList. Guarenteed to never be null. Is read-only. The germ is the short melody from which the entire piece is generated.

Returns:
the germ NoteList

getGermString

public java.lang.String getGermString()
Gets the germ string.

Returns:
the germ string

setGermString

public void setGermString(java.lang.String germString)
                   throws NoteStringParseException
Sets the notes for the germ.

Parameters:
germString - string containing a list of notes
Throws:
NoteStringParseException - if the note list string cannot be parsed

getTempo

public int getTempo()
Gets the tempo of the piece, in beats per minute.

Returns:
the tempo of the piece

setTempo

public void setTempo(int tempo)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the tempo of the piece, in beats per minute.

Parameters:
tempo - the tempo of the piece
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the tempo is outside of the acceptable range

getScale

public Scale getScale()
Returns the Scale. The Scale is used to determine the tonality of the piece, and will also be used to set the key signature of the Midi sequence.

Returns:
the Scale used by this FractalPiece

setScale

public void setScale(Scale scale)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the Scale used by this FractalPiece. The Scale is used to determine the tonality of the piece, and will also be used to set the key signature of the Midi sequence.

Parameters:
scale - the Scale to be used by this FractalPiece
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed scale is null

getGenerateLayeredIntro

public boolean getGenerateLayeredIntro()
Gets whether or not a layered intro should be included in the generated fractal piece.

Returns:
whether or not to generate the layered intro

getTimeSignature

public TimeSignature getTimeSignature()
Gets the time signature for this piece. If none has been set, a default signature of 4/4 will be created.

Returns:
the time signature

Sets the time signature for this piece.

Parameters:

Gets the hash table containing all the VoiceSections for the entire piece.

Returns:
the hash table containing all VoiceSections

getVoices

public VoiceOrSectionList<Voice,Section> getVoices()
Gets a list of Voices for the FractalPiece. To add a Voice, use the provided createVoice() method, rather than attempting to add it to the list on your own.

Returns:
the list of Voices

getSections

public VoiceOrSectionList<Section,Voice> getSections()
Gets a list of Sections for the FractalPiece. To add a Section, use the provided createSection() method, rather than attempting to add it to the list on your own.

Returns:
the list of Sections

normalizeUniqueIndices

public void normalizeUniqueIndices()
Normalizes the unique indices so as to label the items in natural order.

Creates a Voice for the FractalPiece, and adds it to the Voice list.

createVoice

public Voice createVoice(int index)
                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Creates a Voice for the FractalPiece, and adds it to a particular point in the voice list.

Parameters:
index - the point to insert the voice
Returns:
the created voice
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there are more than 15 voices

createSection

public Section createSection()
Creates a Section for the FractalPiece, and adds it to the Section list.

Returns:
the created Section

createSection

public Section createSection(int index)
Creates a Section for the FractalPiece, and inserts it at a particular point in the Section list.

Parameters:
index - the point in the list to insert the section
Returns:
the created Section

createDefaultSettings

public void createDefaultSettings()
Sets up the default settings. If there are already voices, they will be left alone and no new voices will be created. Any section settings will be overriden with new ones.

createDefaultVoices

public void createDefaultVoices()
Creates the default voice settings. This generates three voices. The highest and fastest voice will have self-similarity applied to the pitch and volume.

createDefaultSections

public void createDefaultSections()
Sets up default section settings. Any existing sections will be overriden. This generates one normal section, one inversion section, one retrograde inversion section, and one retrograde section. For each section, the self-similarity is applied to only the fastest voice.

createIntroSections

protected void createIntroSections()
Creates the layered intro sections.

createOutroSections

protected void createOutroSections()
Creates the layered outro sections.

clearTempIntroOutroSections

protected void clearTempIntroOutroSections(int sectionLastUniqueIndex)
Clears out any temporary intro or outro sections. These are created during fractal piece generation and should not be available the rest of the time.

Parameters:
sectionLastUniqueIndex - the lastUniqueIndex to set on the sections

createPieceResultOutputManager

public OutputManager createPieceResultOutputManager()
                                             throws GermIsEmptyException,
                                                    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Creates the output manager for the whole piece.

Returns:
the output manager
Throws:
GermIsEmptyException - if the germ is empty
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there are no voices or sections

createGermOutputManager

public OutputManager createGermOutputManager()
                                      throws GermIsEmptyException
Creates the output manager for the germ.

Returns:
the output manager
Throws:
GermIsEmptyException - if the germ is empty

loadFromXml

public static FractalPiece loadFromXml(java.lang.String xml)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Creates and loads a fractal piece from a serialized xml string.

Parameters:
xml - string containing an xml representation of the fractal piece
Returns:
the new fractal piece
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a deserialization error
